sections.MISSION:
Apache Troop conducts M4 and M249 qualification and stress shoot, on 9APR25, IOT support the Squadrons effort to zero and qualify soldiers as expert marksmen on Range 102.
M4/M249 Qual RG 102
COA SKETCH
COMMANDERS
sections.INTENT:
TRAINING OBJECTIVES:
a. Engage targets with a M4-Series and M249 machine gun
b. Correct malfunctions of a M4-Series and M249 machine gun
c. Establish proper transition habits
Conduct magazine changes
07APR 2025
sections.CONCEPT OF OPERATION:
Task: Apache TRP conducts M4/M249 zero and qualification on 09APR25. Conditions: Soldiers zero, group and qualify (day and night) on their respective weapon system in full dragoon standard at range 102. Give opportunity to shoot under simulated combat conditions.
Standards:
sections.END STATE: is that all firers will zero and qualify on the M4 carbine and M249. Firers are familiar with the new qualification according to TC 3-20.40.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: OIC and RSO will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief immediately following range occupation. Soldiers will coach/safety each other on the firing line with NCOs safetying in a 1:1 ratio. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be improved at the appropriate level. Every Soldier will be considered a safety. If they see an unsafe act they will call a cease fire and notify everyone to stop training until the issue is resolved. This is a living document. OIC and RSO will continuously monitor all aspects of the Qualification Range. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level.
